Eric Kort is a Professor in the Climate and Space Sciences and Engineering Department at the University of Michigan.  Kort's research is focused on atmospheric greenhouse gases and pollutants.

## Education

- [PhD in Applied Physics]{.fw-bold} | Harvard University | 2004 - 2011
- [SM in Applied Physics]{.fw-bold} | Harvard University | 2004 - 2005
- [BA in Physics, minor Mathematics]{.fw-bold} | Pomona College  | 2000-2004  

## Professional Experience

- [2024-present:]{.fw-bold} Professor, University of Michigan
- [2019-2024:]{.fw-bold} Associate Professor, University of Michigan
- [2013-2019:]{.fw-bold} Assistant Professor, University of Michigan
- [2011-2013:]{.fw-bold} W. M. Keck Institute for Space Studies Postdoctoral Fellow, Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology
